glsa.title: FAAD2: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in FAAD2 might lead to user-assisted execution of arbitrary code via an MP4 file.

background.p: FAAD2 is an open source MPEG-4 and MPEG-2 AAC decoder.

description.p: The ICST-ERCIS (Peking University) reported a heap-based buffer overflow in the decodeMP4file() function in frontend/main.c.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted MPEG-4 (MP4) file in an application using FAAD2, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
